sofialatifoils: It was the live tinted movement that brought you to my attention, on my personal insta account, and then I was inspired by you as a business owner and started following from this account earlier this year. You have said what has been in my mind for years.... I haven't seen role models growing up in the UK who look like me. I am now 45 and am loving seeing more people like me in the media, albeit much younger than me, but it is encouraging. It is also making me more brave at saying that I want more people like me to be visible to the older ladies who, like me, spent a very long time just trying to fit in. We didn't have social media when we were growing up, so we only had traditional magazines which were so limited in representing brown people. Carry on please, because it provides fuel to the fire of us older gals!

salinaa.i: I first started watching your YouTube videos on beauty/skincare and absolutely loved your channel and that led me to your IG and the tinted community. I am soooo here for representation and a supportive, non-judgmental community in the beauty industry and I think your values and platform 100% uplift other women and dismantle Eurocentric beauty standards that a lot of us brown girls were trying to conform to. Never stop doing you, the work you're doing is sooo important and inspirational 💕
mutiyaaarr: @deepica Last year I think. Huda beauty shared your video and It was refreshing to see an Indian face making the difference in beauty industry. You inspire me and many other Indian women and give us hope to be the best versions of ourselves one day.
meghchap: I saw your undereye lipstick tutorial and felt so proud that a Telugu girl was making it in the beauty industry. ❤️
paulsalvad: Since Barcelona and I am still wondering what your answer would be ;)
